header.content: Houseconcepts is a sweat and social movement. A unique collective concept of four studios under one roof.

body.content: Shortly after being introduced to the dev team on the project, I was tasked with building out a new store using Shopify to store product data and present the data via the storefront API through a nextJS app.

blocks.content: The majority of the site had already been built out before I joined the team, using a Nextjs set up. The client was looking to add a new section of the site to house a product store. They wanted to manage this data themselves so to avoid a large overhead of CMS creation, we opted to go with a Shopify backend.
To create a connection between the two systems and use Shopify as a headless CMS, I implemented the storefront api with GraphQL for efficiency.

After setting up a simple shopify store, the client began adding products for me to test. I collected the data via Shopify’s storefront api and stored state of the app with Redux to enable global features without creating a mess of the components with props eg the Ajax cart.
I was then able to generate a checkout link and take advantage of Shopify’s already built out checkout system to handle client payments.
